Aurora Performance Highlights

Now that Aurora is fully assembled, ECP and ESP team members are beginning to transition their work to the supercomputer to ready their applications for full system runs. Here are some early performance results on Aurora.


Brain Connectome Reconstruction at Scale: Large-Scale Connectomics with Flood-Filling Networks

PI: Nicola Ferrier, Argonne National Laboraotory

High-Energy Particle Physics at Scale: CosmicTagger

PI: Corey Adams, Argonne National Laboratory

Accelerating Drug Design and Discovery

PI: Archit Vasan, Argonne National Laboratory

Unlocking the Secrets of Molecular Science: GAMESS

PI: Mark Gordon, Iowa State University

Learning from the Sky Ising the Hardware/Hybrid Accelerated Cosmology Code: CRK- HACC

PI: Katrin Heitmann, Salman Habib, Argonne National Laboratory

High-Performance Computational Chemistry: NWChemEx

PI: Theresa Windus, Ames National Laboratory and Iowa State University

Monte Carlo Neutron and Photon Transport Simulations: OpenMC

PI: Steven Hamilton, Oak Ridge National Laboratory; Paul Romano, Jon Tramm, Argonne National Laboratory

Multiphysics Magnetic Fusion Reactor Simulations: XGC

PI: Choongseok Chang, Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory
